ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok this REALLY falls into the whiney player category.  If I d known this was what you were posting about earlier I wouldn t have replied to your message at
ygData.messageBody:
Ok this REALLY falls into the "whiney player" category. If I'd known this
was what you were posting about earlier I wouldn't have replied to your
message at all on whineplay.

Sorry my friend but Duping bugs, corpse loss bugs, item poofing bugs etc
take FAR more priority, to me, than fixing a song that I have learned to do
without. I'd FAR rather not be able to mez than to lose all my hard earned
items to a corpse poofing bug.

Complaining about reality is one thing but they HAVE had some pretty major
bugs pop up over the past couple weeks that really do take priority over
fixing things like a secondary resist on our songs. I'm not saying our
songs aren't important to me, far from it, but I really think we need to
keep things in perspective.

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath since Beta 2
----- Original Message -----
From: "Stephen E. McCloskey" <s.mccloskey@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 23, 2000 2:27 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed


> You can find a snip of it on www.eqvault.com in the news.
> I know it was somewhere on the whineplay general forum, but with the
> servers currently down I can't connect to it with all the traffic.
>
> [Quote from original post: 4. When will the bard songs lullaby (AOE mes
> song), chains (level 23 non-exploited snare song) and pixie strike (target
> mes song) be fixed?]
>
> Gord'o:
> Ester is looking into lullaby and pixie strike, but we've had some other
> things pop up over the past few weeks that have taken priority. Regarding
> chains, it's working as it is supposed to. I understand that the claim is
> that it doesn't work as well as it did before NPC change that wasn't
> necessarily supposed to affect it, however upon looking into it we've
> determined that the way it works now is sufficient for the spell.
>
>
> At 11:27 AM 8/23/00 -0600, you wrote:
> >Where did you see comments from GZ that she had been taken off? I missed
> >them somehow.
> >
> > Kit
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Daniel Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
> >Sent: Wednesday, August 23, 2000 11:14 AM
> >To: EQ Bards
> >Subject: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed
> >
> >
> >I'm very annoyed by GZ's comments stating Ester was yanked from our
problem.
> >See this post
